## total age

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{number peaks} & \sim \text{poisson}(\lambda) \\
\log{\lambda} & = \alpha_\text{individual} + \beta * \text{standardised age} \\
\alpha_\text{individual} & \sim \text{normal}(\bar{\alpha},\ \sigma_\text{individual}) \\
\bar{\alpha} & \sim \text{normal}(1.5,\ 0.5) \\
\beta & \sim \text{normal}(0,\ 1) \\
\sigma_\text{individual} & \sim \text{exponential}(1)
\end{aligned}$$

## direct age

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{number peaks} & \sim \text{poisson}(\lambda) \\
\log{\lambda} & = \alpha_\text{individual}\ + \\
  & \ \ \ \ \ \beta_\text{age} * \text{standardised age}\ + \\
  & \ \ \ \ \ \beta_\text{degree} * \text{standardised degree}\ + \\
  & \ \ \ \ \ \beta_\text{tree} * \text{standardised tree size}\\
\alpha_\text{individual} & \sim \text{normal}(\bar{\alpha},\ \sigma_\text{individual}) \\
\bar{\alpha} & \sim \text{normal}(1.5,\ 0.5) \\
\beta_\text{age}, \beta_\text{degree}, \beta_\text{tree} & \sim \text{normal}(0,\ 1) \\
\sigma_\text{individual} & \sim \text{exponential}(1)
\end{aligned}$$

## total tree

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{number peaks} & \sim \text{poisson}(\lambda) \\
\log{\lambda} & = \alpha_\text{individual}\ + \\
  & \ \ \ \ \ \alpha_\text{sex}\
  & \ \ \ \ \ \beta_\text{age} * \text{standardised age}\ + \\
  & \ \ \ \ \ \beta_\text{entry} * \text{standardised entry size}\ + \\
  & \ \ \ \ \ \beta_\text{tree} * \text{standardised tree size}\\
\alpha_\text{individual} & \sim \text{normal}(\bar{\alpha},\ \sigma_\text{individual}) \\
\alpha_\text{sex} & \sim \text{normal}(0,\ \sigma_\text{sex}) \\
\bar{\alpha} & \sim \text{normal}(1.5,\ 0.5) \\
\beta_\text{age}, \beta_\text{degree}, \beta_\text{tree}, \beta_\text{entry} & \sim \text{normal}(0,\ 1) \\
\sigma_\text{individual}, \sigma_\text{sex} & \sim \text{exponential}(1)
\end{aligned}$$
